title: Emmerdale spoilers: Robert learns his fate tonight as he is jailed
text:
Robert Sugden (Ryan Hawley) tonight faces his fate in sad Emmerdale scenes as he is sentenced and jailed for murder following the death of evil rapist Lee Posner. Robert lashed out at Victoria Barton’s (Isabel Hodgins) vile attacker and when he recently died, Robert knew that it would be a long time before he saw the outside of a prison cell.

He initially attempted to go on the run with his husband and soulmate Aaron Dingle (Danny Miller) but after realising how much Aaron would lose by being a fugitive from the law, he made the ultimate sacrifice and gave himself up so Aaron had the chance of a life.

Aaron is struggling to deal with his marriage ending up this way – and Robert is visibly shaken and emotional as he takes the stand tonight and hears his fate. As a sentence is passed, Aaron buries his head in his hands.

With Victoria and Liv (Isobel Steele) by his side, Aaron struggles to process the enormity of what has happened. As he watches the man he loves sent down, life will never be the same again – but what does the future hold for the couple? And can Robert cope with the stretch ahead of him?

We can’t reveal the sentence that is passed to Robert but can confirm that this is the character’s exit storyline after Ryan Hawley made the decision to leave the show earlier this year. And it will be a difficult watch for Robron fans, who have invested in the relationship as it has developed over the years.

It’s a bittersweet day as Chas (Lucy Pargeter) has welcomed Aaron’s baby sister to the world and tonight, he tries to seek comfort in that good news and holds her for the first time. But as he faces up to a life without Robert, it’s very clear that he is not going to cope.

With Aaron about to go off the rails, the end of Robert’s story could be the beginning of a tough new one for Aaron…

Emmerdale airs Robert’s sentencing on Thursday 24th October at 7pm on ITV.
